Class StockMarket

java.lang.Object
Skeleton.Unit
StockMarket
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class StockMarket extends Unit
The StockMarket class is the core simulation engine for the stock trading environment. It manages buyer threads, market price updates, available shares, and external influences such as news events. Key features include:
  • Dynamic price updates based on buy/sell pressure and market sentiment
  • Major positive or negative events that impact the market through curated news headlines
  • Observer pattern integration to notify stocks and buyers of state changes
  • GUI synchronization with real-time updates via the ArrowPanel
  • Pause/resume functionality via semaphores
  • Thread-safe simulation loop with support for multiple buyers running in parallel
The StockMarket extends the Unit class as part of the simulation framework, and is expected to override performAction, submitStatistics, and run.

  • Field Details

    • positiveEvents

      String[] positiveEvents
      Array of predefined positive news events that can trigger a stock price increase. Used in major market event simulations.

    • negativeEvents

      String[] negativeEvents
      Array of predefined negative news events that can trigger a stock price decrease. Used in major market event simulations.

    • lastEventBias

      private double lastEventBias
      Bias introduced by the last major event, ranging from -1.0 (strongly negative) to +1.0 (strongly positive). Helps influence the direction of future events.

    • marketBias

      private double marketBias
      Current overall market sentiment bias. Affects the direction and magnitude of price fluctuations.

    • nextMajorEventTick

      private int nextMajorEventTick
      Tick count after which the next major market event will occur.

    • rand

      private final Random rand
      Random number generator used for major event logic and noise simulation.

    • buyers

      private final List<Buyer> buyers
      List of all buyer instances participating in the market.

    • AmountSold

      int AmountSold
      Total number of shares sold in the current tick.

    • AmountBought

      int AmountBought
      Total number of shares bought in the current tick.

    • waiting

      static int waiting
      Delay in milliseconds between each simulation tick. Lower values speed up the simulation.

    • TrackedStock

      Stock TrackedStock
      The singleton Stock object that tracks price and share history.

    • avalibleShares

      private int avalibleShares
      The number of shares currently available for trading in the market.

    • Stocks

      private List<MarketObserver> Stocks
      List of observers (MarketObserver implementations) that react to market updates.

      double MarketPrice
      The current price of the stock in the market.

      Semaphore used to control pausing and resuming the simulation safely across threads.

      private volatile boolean paused
      Flag indicating whether the simulation is currently paused.

      private boolean wasBuy
      Indicates whether any stock was bought during the current tick.

      private boolean wasSell
      Indicates whether any stock was sold during the current tick.

      private final Random rng
      Random number generator used specifically for price noise and decay.

      int Time
      Logical simulation clock representing elapsed ticks since start.

      static int Now
      Shared global tick counter across simulation.

    • open

      static boolean open
      Global flag indicating whether the market is currently open.

    • lastNews

      static String lastNews
      The most recent news event headline. Displayed in the UI.

  • Constructor Details

    • StockMarket

      public StockMarket(SimulationInput input)
      Constructs a basic StockMarket instance with a reference to simulation input. This constructor is typically used for unit testing or minimal initialization.
      Parameters:
      input - the simulation configuration input

    • StockMarket

      public StockMarket(SimulationInput input, int totalShares, double InitialPrice, int time, int now)
      Constructs a fully initialized StockMarket simulation with a tracked stock, buyer registry, news system, and major event scheduler.
      Parameters:
      input - the simulation input object containing runtime parameters
      totalShares - the total number of shares available at the beginning of the simulation
      InitialPrice - the initial market price of the stock
      time - the initial simulation time (used for time tracking)
      now - the starting tick count of the simulation

      public void buy(int amount, Buyer buyer)

      Parameters:

      buyer - the buyer performing the sale

    • updateStockPrice

      void updateStockPrice()
      Recalculates the stock price based on trading activity and random factors. Also applies resistance, market bias, and price constraints.
